org.apache.pirk.utils

Class SystemConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.pirk.utils.SystemConfiguration

  • public class SystemConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages system properties. At first loading of this class, it will:

    1) Load in the DEFAULT_PROPERTY_FILE, if found on the classpath. (Currently 'pirk.properties')

    2) Load in any properties files in the LOCAL_PROPERTIES_DIR. The filenames must end with '.properties'

    3) Load in properties from the QUERIER_PROPERTIES_FILE and RESPONDER_PROPERTIES_FILE

        Returns:

      • getIntProperty

        public static int getIntProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
                 int defaultValue)
        Gets the specified property as an int, or the default value if the property isn't found.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - The name of the requested int property value.
        defaultValue - The value to return if the property is undefined.
        Returns:
        The value of the requested property, or the default value if the property is undefined.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If the property does not contain a parsable int value.

      • getBooleanProperty

        public static boolean getBooleanProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
                         boolean defaultValue)
        Gets the specified property as a boolean, or the default value if the property isn't defined.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - The name of the requested boolean property value.
        defaultValue - The value to return if the property is undefined.
        Returns:
        true if the property is defined and has the value "true", otherwise defaultValue.

      • isSetTrue

        public static boolean isSetTrue(java.lang.String propertyName)
        Returns true iff the specified boolean property value is "true".

        If the property is not found, or it's value is not "true" then the method will return false.

        Parameters:
        propertyName - The name of the requested boolean property value.
        Returns:
        true if the property is defined and has the value "true", otherwise false.

      • setProperty

        public static void setProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
               java.lang.String value)
        Sets the property to the given value.

        Any previous values stored at the same property name are replaced.

        Parameters:
        propertyName - The name of the property to set.
        value - The property value.

      • hasProperty

        public static boolean hasProperty(java.lang.String propertyName)
        Returns true iff the given property name is defined.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - The property name to test.
        Returns:
        true if the property is found in the configuration, or false otherwise.

      • appendProperty

        public static void appendProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
                  java.lang.String value)
        Appends a property via a comma separated list

        If the property does not exist, it adds it.

        Parameters:
        propertyName - The property whose value is to be appended with the given value.
        value - The value to be stored, or appended to the current value.

      • loadPropsFromDir

        public static void loadPropsFromDir(java.lang.String dirName)
        Loads the properties from local properties file in the specified directory.

        All files ending in '.properties' will be loaded. The new properties are added to the current system configuration.

        Parameters:
        dirName - The directory to search for the new properties files.

      • loadPropsFromFile

        public static void loadPropsFromFile(java.io.File file)
        Loads the properties from the specified file.

        The new properties are added to the current system configuration.

        Parameters:
        file - The properties file containing the system properties to add.

      • loadPropsFromResource

        public static void loadPropsFromResource(java.lang.String name)
        Loads the properties from the specified resource on the current classloader.

        The new properties are added to the current system configuration.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the resource defining the properties.
